text: Loud whiz of night insects. Moonlight is reflected on silver leaves in the olive grov thin cloud drifts over the face of the moon. A DEEP VOICE somewhere in the olive garden murmurs low, undecipherable words. We search for the SOURCE of the voice, and approach the m of a hidden GROTTO. The nearer we get, the louder the BUZZ of insects. JOST INSIDE the GROTTO, the OUTLINE of a LARGE MAN (JESUS NAZARETH) is visible, kneeling against rock, His head res on His RIGHT FOREARM. A night predator’s SCREECH outside interrupts His prayer. His arm drops from his forehead, He stands and steps out the cave, into the moonlight. The HISS of insects intensi to a new pitch of hysteria. JESUS is a tall, strongly built man. There is vigorous authority in His features, even though His face is DRENCH with perspiration. He steps away from the mouth of the ca and up toward a large TREE under which THREE FIGURES lie sleeping. An OWL perched one of its branches sees JESUS approach, t silent flight. As it rises, we pull back. The WALLS of JERUSALEM are revealed, in the distance. Between them and the Garden, TORCHLIGHT. We move in.

location: CEDRON STREAM, ROAD OUTSIDE JERUSALEM WALLS. NIGHT.

text: A GROUP OF SOLDIERS have stopped by a STREAM (CEDRON). Th of the men hold torches while TWO OTHERS struggle to lift OLD FALLEN TREE-TRUNK from where it has been placed, acro the torrent. The soldiers holding the torches scan the area, wary and watchful. The WALLS of JERUSALEM are visible, half a mile away. The two men finally dislodge the log, lift it with some difficulty onto their shoulders.
et EXT. GARDEN OF OLIVES. NIGHT. JESUS steps up to the sleeping figures and stops. As soon He stops, so does the BUZZ of insects. Ring of silence

Peter. The three men abruptly WAKE, scramble to their feet. JESUS (cont’d) Could you not watch with me a while? Their dark CLOAKS fall away and their faces are revealed: PETER, bearded and gruff, with clear eyes on a mobile fac JAMES, thoughtful, more private; JOHN, young, whose passionate faith in JESUS is boundless and palpable. The three men stare at the SWEAT-SOAKED face of JESUS.
Master, what has happened to you?
(whisper) Should T call the others, Lord? JESUS starts to tremble. The three APOSTLES start to reac out, but He shakes His head.
No, John, They should not see me under this cloud.
Master...are you in danger? Should we take flight?
Stay here, Peter. Keep watch, pray. He turns away from the three baffled Apostles and steps b down toward the GROTTO below.
(whisper) What is happening to Him?
He is afraid. He spoke of danger, even as we ate supper. Of betrayal and... (CONTINUED)

The HIGH-PICHED SIZZLE of insects interrupts Peter ~ they have begun their hissing with the same suddenness with wh they stopped. The three men look down at the SILHOUETTE o JESUS approaching the mouth of the GROTTO. EXT. GROTTO. GARDEN OF OLIVES. NIGHT. JESUS stops in front of the cave, stares at the SHADOW of dead tree-trunk, then lifts His eyes to the sky. A cloud slides over the moon, killing her light. JESUS turns again to the TREE STUMP, which, in the sudden darkness, casts a PALE UN-SHADOW onto the ground, an INVERSION OF A SHADOW, which SLITHERS INTO THE GROTTO. The HISS of the insects has reached a maddening pitch. JESUS steps inside the dark cave,

location: CHAMBER IN THE TEMPLE. JERUSALEM. NIGHT.

text: The SCREECH and GROAN of metal against wood. A heavy door closed. The rich chamber is lit by wall torches. Here and there the brilliance of gold is reflected. An intelligent face, eyes bright with anticipation (JUDAS looks over his shoulder as a TEMPLE GUARD OFFICER (MALCHU closes the doors, turns to face the room. A half-dozen MEN in opulent robes stand in the center of chamber, at self-conscious distance from JUDAS, The man in the RICHEST ROBES (CAIPHAS) addresses MALCHUS, has already reached into a SATCHEL inside his shirt.

Thirty, Malchus,. CAIPHAS turns slowly to look at JUDAS as he speaks. JUDAS is focusing exclusively on MALCHUS. CAIPHAS (cont’ d) That is what we settled on,,..thirty, was it not, Judas? JUDAS nods as time slows down. (CONTINUED)

MALCHUS pulls a STRING OF SILVER COINS from the satchel a tosses it at JUDAS. The THROW is not well aimed, and JUDA forced to back away and spin toward the HIGH PRIESTS and their accolites, whose expressions of contempt FLASH befo his eyes as he leaps up and snatches the string of coins of the air. CAIPHAS laughs. JUDAS looks down at the silver in his hands. TIME slows down further as JUDAS turns to MALCHUS, who ha opened the doors. A handful of SOLDIERS stand outside, expectantly. Inside, laughter has broken out among the high priests.

Startled, PETER scrambles to his feet once again. JOHN an JAMES also sit up, tense. Quick exchange of looks. Moonlight floods the Garden of Olives. The HISS of insect has receded and been replaced with OTHER NOISES, less eas identifiable, coming from the grotto area. A CRY OF PAIN, followed by CACKLES and GUFFAWS. JOHN starts to step down toward the GROTTO but PETER grab his arm, stops him.

No, you stay here, both of you. I will join him...you stay and keep watch. PETER steps quickly down toward the GROTTO entrance but S when he hears PANDEMONIC NOISES coming from inside. An odd LIGHT illuminates the underbrush hiding the cave entrance and the VIOLENT SOUNDS INSIDE THE CAVE INCREASE. PETER looks back. JAMES and JOHN stand under the tree and peer back at him. PETER faces the GROTTO again.
(CONTINUED)

JESUS’ face is now covered with blood as well as sweat. He kneels in the center of the cave, facing a large SHAPE FORM, so DARK that, by contrast, the darkness around it i made visible, Parts of the FORM stretch out, then quickly withdraw as t get too close to JESUS. A cacophony of airless grunts and howls fills the air in the grotto. Then silence, A light, musical voice, rich with the dissonance of malice:
Do you really believe that one man may bear the penalty for...all sin?

Hear me, Father. Be my defence, keep me safe from traps that are set for me. Shelter me, Lord, I place myself in your care, I place my trust in you. As JESUS prays, the DARK FORM LIFTS OFF THE GROUND and ra a PORTION OF ITSELF HIGHER STILL. WITHIN IT, as if a feti curtain had been lifted, the FLASH-IMAGE of a TEEMING MULTITUDE of MEN and WOMEN appears, dissolves within itse and reemerges again. FROM the hellish IMAGE a SNAKE EMERG slithers to the ground and toward JESUS. PETER stumbles into the darkness and calls out:

Master, what is it? Speak to me, say something...I can’t see where to look for you. PETER‘s eyes adjust. He sees JESUS, on His knees, His ent body rigid with concentration, PETER scrambles toward Him, then stops. A sudden wash of moonlight floods the cave revealing JESUS’ face to him. PETER (cont’d) You are bleeding, Lord! What is happening...? JESUS remains motionless on His knees. He seems completel unaware of PRTER. PETER starts to move to reach for JESUS but STOPS as he becomes aware of the SNAKE. The reptile slides over PETER hands and HISSES. (CONTINUED)
PETER looks for JESUS, but now sees ONLY DARKNESS. He BAC OUT of the cave on all fours, gasping for breath. JESUS has not moved.

No man can pay the price, I tell you. It is too high. No man can offer what is owed. Ever. (beat) Never. JESUS does not respond. The CACOPHONY from within the darkness starts again, and increases in volume.

The streets of Jerusalem near the TEMPLE building. MALCHU JUDAS and a dozen SOLDIERS carrying torches emerge from t TEMPLE and quickly make their way down narrow cobbled Streets. Men, women and children are still out and about, sporadically highlighted by the TORCHES. JUDAS seems surprised by the speed and urgency with which SOLDIERS are moving. He holds the STRING OF SILVER COINS his hands. The group arrives at one of the CITY GATES of JERUSALEM a come to a stop. MALCHUS signals GUARDS to open the gates, then turns to JUDAS who is looking down at the string of silver coins in his hands. Sensing the eyes of MALCHUS on JUDAS looks up.
Where?

(points) Gethsemani. MALCHUS’ eyes meet those of a SECOND OFFICER, who NUDGES JUDAS forward. The party moves out. EXT. GARDEN OF OLIVES. NIGHT. INSIDE the GROTTO, the unnatural groans and howls contain within the DARK FORM seem to MULTIPLY. The face of JESUS is soaking with sweat and blood, a mask internal conflict. He kneels, and sits back on His heels, clutched fists resting on the ground beside Him. (CONTINUED)

Father, all things are possible to You. If it is possible, let this chalice pass from me. But only if it is Your will. May Your will be done. The cries and groans coming from the dark form in front o Him subside. The SNAKE slowly slides up to where JESUS is kneeling, and stops directly in front of Him.

(low, edge of hesitancy) Who are you? JESUS slowly stands up, He does not dignify the question an answer, nor even look to the reptile at His feet. He lifts His foot and brings it down with force on the snake’s head. The NOISE of it expunges all other sound. JESUS steps out of the grotto into moonlight. He lifts Hi tormented eyes to the moon, A breeze. Then silence. A dee silence, like a weight. JESUS lowers His eyes, scans the below the garden. His eyes stop. EXT. ROAD TO GETHSEMANL. NIGHT. Torches. SOLDIERS. Then the TWO MEN CARRYING the LOG they lifted from across the CEDRON TORRENT. The group STOPS. MORE TORCHES as MALCHUS and JUDAS’ gang do not stop, but SOLDIERS greet/insult each other with familiarity. MALCHUS and a SECOND OFFICER step in, order silence and separate the two groups, shoving their men forward. As th two parties separate, MALCHUS takes JUDAS by the arm
Does the Nazarene have men with him? JUDAS laughs.
Men? You mean soldiers? No. He has a few fishermen,
JESUS walks up to where PETER, JAMES and JOHN have once m Sat back against the tree and are again asleep. He looks down on them with affection, then leans forward shakes each of them lightly.

Wake up, friends. Now is not the time for sleep, but for prayer. He points downward, to the road JUST BELOW THE GARDEN OF OLIVES. The Apostles rise to their feet. Sleepy, frighten they peer down at where He’s pointing. POV: TORCHES moving along the road, slowly, searchingly. MEN are unrecognizable, but not their uniforms. JESUS (cont’d) The man who will betray me is drawing near. PETER reaches under his cloak, where a SWORD is revealed, its SCABBARD. JESUS rests a hand on PETER’s shoulder and shakes His head. EXT, PATH IN GETHSEMANI. NIGHT. MALCHUS at the head of his TEMPLE GUARDS. JUDAS marches beside him, unhappily. Suddenly MALCHUS raises his hand a stops. The rest follow suit. Still in the garden, just off the path, JESUS emerges out the darkness. PETER, JAMES, JOHN are by His side. They st out onto the path. JESUS motions His Apostles to stop. He then steps forward. JUDAS takes a step back, then a second. He is turning to when MALCHUS’ hand GRABS him and YANKS him back.
Who are you looking for? MALCHUS still holds JUDAS by the scruff of the neck. He glances at JUDAS, his jaw set hard, then faces JESUS.
We are looking for JESUS of Nazareth. As he speaks, MALCHUS glances back at his men, nodding cu to his SECOND OFFICER, The soldiers holding torches shift these to their LEFT HAND, (CONTINUED)
JESUS turns His eyes to JUDAS.

I am he. The SECOND OFFICER signals his men, who tighten their rin around JESUS and the three Apostles. It is a tense, uneasy gathering. Faces flicker in torchli and reflect the men’s uncertainty. MALCHUS turns to JUDAS, whose eyes have never left JESUS’ PETER, JAMES and JOHN look at JUDAS in silent outrage. PE takes a step but two of the soldiers grab onto his arms. PETER struggles with ferocity, breaks loose, loses his balance and falls to the ground. JUDAS glances at MALCHUS, then steps forward. As he reach JESUS, he nervously opens his arms:

Hail, Rabbi. He lurches forward and awkwardly wraps his arms around JE kisses Him on the cheek. He then stumbles back, feverishl wiping at his lips as if they had been burned. JESUS’ eyes never leave those of JUDAS.

Judas...you would betray the Son of Man with a kiss? Time slows down. MALCHUS waves his men forward, pointing at JESUS. The soldiers grab hold of JAMES and JOHN. This time it is JOHN who struggles with fury against the Strong hold of the soldiers. They try to hold him, but he HITS HARD. They can only hold his clothes. He tugs and pu so violently that he wiggles right out of them and DASHES into the night, wearing only a loin cloth. PETER, who has watched JUDAS’ act of betrayal from where fell now watches the soldiers burst into action. IGNORED by all, JUDAS backs away from the scene. He is guickly engulfed in darkness, still wiping his lips. (CONTINUED)

location: ORCHARD OUTSIDE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. NIGHT.

text: The pale figure of JOHN running toward the city walls, ZI ZAGGING between the fruit trees, his face slapping agains the occasional low branch.

PETER reaches for his SWORD as he scrambles to get back t his feet. Knocked back and buffeted by the momentum of th surge, he cannot see what is happening. Pulling his sword from its scabbard, eyes reddened by anger, he catches sig of MALCHUS stepping in to arrest JESUS. The sword descends with deadly energy. JESUS, whose hands suddenly BECOME FREE, pushes MALCHUS a from the FULL FORCE of IMPACT, but the sharp weapon still catches MALCHUS on the side of the head, CLEANLY SEVERING

head_text.subj: HIS EAR, WHICH FLIES THROUGH THE TORCHLIT AIR. THE EAR LA
IN THE DUST IN FRONT OF JESUS.

text: MALCHUS falls to the ground, howling with pain. PETER has stopped as his eyes meet those of JESUS. The SOLDIERS around them have completely lost their composure, They tighten their grip on JAMES, bringing him his knees and holding his arms behind his back. SHOUTS, CLANG of metal weapons, confusion in the melee. JESUS is the only one who has retained His calm. Afraid of PETER, the arresting soldiers have not taken hold of H He steps forward, places one hand on PETER’s shoulder and takes the sword from him. He LETS DROP the weapon which f to the dust, next to the BLOODY EAR, ONLY MALCHUS’ CRY OF PAIN NOW FILLS THE AIR. JESUS reaches down, PICKS UP THE BLOOD-SOAKED EAR, YANKS MALCHUS to his feet, his face covered with blood, his han held over the wound, Very matter-of~factly, JESUS then ta MALCHUS’ hand away from the wound and SLAPS THE EAR BACK ITS PLACE. The ear stays where it belongs. The blood is no longer bl only dust. MALCHUS touches his ear, looks at his hand and stops screaming. His eyes meet those of JESUS. (CONTINUED)
ll.

The nearly naked figure of JOHN running swiftly along nar cobbled streets, barely illuminated by the occasional tor His BREATHING is now fast, tired. A contingent of ROMAN SOLDIERS. JOHN stops, ducks into an even smaller ALLEY, stops breathing as the men walk pa laughing. He waits, shaking with the effort ef holding his breath. He peers around the corner of the street. Empty. His breath explodes. He takes off again.

TIME has resumed its rhythm. The soldiers, reacting to the BARK of the SECOND OFFICER, SEIZE JESUS, quickly tie His hands behind His back and wr chains and strong ropes around His waist. MALCHUS is frozen in place, his hand resting on his ear, eyes glued to those of JESUS. JESUS (cont! d) You have come to arrest me with chains and rope, as if I were a common thief. Yet I sat with you in the Temple, and you did not lay hands upon me. The SECOND OFFICER, eyeing MALCHUS with contempt, now ste up to JESUS.
Are you a wizard, Galilean? Truly? If so, you can break ropes and chains... ONE of the soldiers wrapping the chains around the waist JESUS laughs.
Break these? No chance, I tell you! The soldier SWINGS the loose end of the chain. It HITS JESUS squarely on the side of His face!

MARY (Holy Mother of JESUS) opens her eyes wide. She sits in the small bed, an expression of anguish spreading over strong features. She reaches up, touches her cheek then l down at her hand. The room is quiet, dimly lit by oil-lamps. The faint sound of sleep-breathing. A WOMAN (MAGDALEN) lies on a cot near MARY’s bed. She seems to be asleep. At the foot of her cot, TWO MORE WOME their faces covered by veils, lie fast asleep. MARY swings her feet to the floor, stands up, steps towar MAGDALEN’s cot, stops, becomes motionless. She turns to t door and tilts her head, as if listening. MAGDALEN’s eyes open. She is a beautiful woman with a remarkable mane of thick hair.
(softly) What, Mary? What is it? MARY is startled by the whisper. She looks at MAGADLEN, distracted, puts her fingers to her lips then points to t door.

Shhh. Listen. He is coming...here. MAGDALEN stretches her neck around to also look. She frow kicks away the blanket covering her. MARY reaches for the door when it is FLUNG OPEN. JOHN stumbles to the floor as he avoids crashing into her. MAGDALEN screams. JOHN’s chest is heaving with breathless exhaustion, his face is covered with cuts and dirt, his e are red with tears. Suddenly conscious of his near-nakedn he lowers his head in shame and despair.

They have seized him, Mary...tied him in ropes and chains. They are beating him, insulting him, dragging him into the city like a common thief... MARY’s reaction is to become absolutely still. Her eyes n leave JOHN’s, but clearly they no longer see him. (CONTINUED)

The face is twisted into a mask of enthusiastic hatred. I belongs to one of the soldiers holding one of the ropes t to JESUS’ waist, The man is walking backward, his nose no more than ten inches away from that of JESUS

Son of a menstruating mother. Bastard son, not by her husband, AM I RIGHT? JESUS tries to look at the man, but is being purposefully yanked, pushed and pulled every which way by the other me holding ropes and chains. The side of His face where the chain-link landed is swollen and blue. Guffaws and leers among the torchlit soldiers, We pull back along the road to where the arrest was made. PETER and JAMES are suddenly illuminated by moonlight. Their POV: The torchlit band, moving toward the walls of Jerusalem. PETER and JAMES become aware of MALCHUS, standing still. PETER glances at JAMES, reaches for his sword. MALCHUS watches PETER pick up the sword, takes a step back. PETER shakes his head, slides the weapon back in its scabbard.
I will not harm you. (turns to James) Go, tell the others what has happened. Take this man with you. He will bear witness...(at Malchus) will you not? MALCHUS nods.

What will you do, Peter? PETER (cont’d) I/1l stay near to Him and...get word to you when I can. JAMES starts to turn away. PETER grabs his arm. PETER (cont’d) Be watchful. Be careful. We are all in danger now, God be with you. JAMES and MALCHUS head off into the darkness. PETER watches them go, then runs after the torches.
oe
JOHN emerges from the dark doorway, scans the street. MAR steps out directly behind him, leaning on his arm. They a followed by MAGDALEN.
But who, John? And how could...?

(interrupts her) The Pharisees, Magdalen. Caiphas and the High Priests. How? They bought Judas...and Judas betrayed him. He came to Olivet with Temple Guards. MARY covers her head with a veil, turns to the other two

The temple, John. We should be where they will bring him...to the temple, She lets go of JOHN’s arm and heads up the street. EXT. ROAD FROM GETHSEMANI. NIGHT. The TORCHLIT band of Temple Guard soldiers approaches a l BRIDGE across a wide stream, dragging JESUS along by the ropes and chains. PETER, in the darkness not far behind them, watches, his reflected in the torchlight - watery, angry, afraid. JESUS struggles merely to stay on his feet. He has lost H sandals along the road, and His feet have started to blee ONE of the GUARDS sees this and produces a THIN REED with which he WHIPS JESUS’ feet.
What was his name? Not Joseph...no, I’m talking about your real father. Oh yes, Pandera,..that’s it,
Pandera? You mean the great seducer, (looks at JESUS scornfully) No wonder he consorts with trash and prostitutes
Ah, well, bastards are all clever, aren’t you? Clever, degenerate filth! (CONTINUED)

ae 45. CONTINUED; Each accompanies his insult with a heavy blow. The last with a mouthful of spit. The group has reached the middle of the low bridge. Thoug the hands of JESUS have come loose, the ropes and chains which bind Him make it nearly impossible for Him to move, This obvious vulnerability inspires the brutality of His captors. The SHADOW of this is reflected in the water of stream below the low bridge. In the shadows UNDER the bridge a pair of luminous eyes w the reflection of the violent beating. JUDAS, still wipin and pawing at his now bloodied lips. The BEATING of JESUS reaches such a fevered pitch that He literally PICKED UP and BODILY TOSSED over the side. UNDER THE BRIDGE, JUDAS watches JESUS FALL INTO THE SHALL WATER ON ALL FOURS, FIRST ON HIS KNEES then HIS HANDS, entangled in a disorder of hemp and chain. JUDAS withdraws further into the SHADOWS, where he seems become ENFOLDED in a mantle of darkness. He becomes AWARE that what surrounds him is ANIMATED and tries to BREAK FR of its shapelessness. All in vain. It covers him up entir all of him EXCEPT HIS EYES, which widen as they peer at reflected torchlight on the water where: JESUS, bruised and now drenched, looks up and SEES JUDAS, TIME SEEMS TO STOP for a brief moment. Then JESUS lowers His head to the stream and drinks thirs before the ROPES and CHAINS are once more YANKED UPWARDS He is strangled half to death before being dumped back on the bridge. More beatings. UNDER the bridge, the darkness drifts away from JUDAS, wh darts out into the open stream and watches the violent procession move along the road. He lowers his eyes to the water, reaches down, splashes some of it onto his bloodie lips, GASPS, MUFFLES a SCREAM of pain and rushes out of t stream, into the darkness. EXT. STREETS OF JERUSALEM. NIGHT. A number of separate men are seen KNOCKING ON DOORS in different parts of the city, whispering to those who open doors, moving on. A series of GROUPS of MEN and WOMEN, even CHILDREN, emerg from houses in the narrow streets, some carrying torches, meeting up with other groups. (CONTINUED)
JOHN, MARY and MAGDALEN find themselves rushing ALONGSIDE of these groups,

...that’s what he said, that they’ve arrested Jesus of Nazareth, that his followers will try to start a revolt, that we should go to the temple. JOHN turns to look at MARY, who returns his look as they up their pace and move ahead of the group. MAGDALEN covers her head and shakes a woman by the arm:
But isn’t Jesus Galilean? How can they arrest a Galilean in Jerusalem?
Caiphas can have anybody arrested.

Yes. Anybody but a Roman. The WOMAN looks at MAGDALEN now, and tries to remember something about her, but MAGDALEN rushes ahead and joins and JOHN. She looks and acts like a fighter. EXT. SHEEP PEN NEAR THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. NIGHT. By the side of the road is a pen filled with sheep and LAMBS, all watching the approaching TORCHES. A DARK FIGURE leaps over a FENCE into their midst. The ANIMALS scatter with LOUD, PLAINTIVE BLEATINGS. JUDAS, hi clothes torn, face tortured, LIPS BLEEDING where he keeps TEARING AT THE FLESH, EYES WILD. He mutters undecipherabl His watches the TORCHES approach. PEOPLE suddenly appear alongside the road, some from with the walls, others from their homes. The SECOND OFFICER sees the men and women peering at JESU past the torchlight. Some show sympathy, sorrow, He nudges the nearest soldier:
Close-up ranks. Now. On the double. He nods his chin in the direction of the onlookers. The soldier looks, grunts the message to his nearest colleagu (CONTINUED)

The men shorten the ropes and chains binding JESUS, and f a tighter group. The SECOND OFFICER shouts at the people lining the road. SECOND OFFICER (cont’d) Stay back, all of you. Keep away. Get back to your homes.
That’s Jesus of Nazareth you’ve tied in chains. What has he done to deserve such treatment? He is a man of God.

If that’s what you think, then he has deceived you. He is a false prophet. More faces have appeared as the procession approaches the city gates, The people are NOISY despite the late hour, T SECOND OFFICER looks worried. So do the soldiers.

What you say is false. He is a healer. By whose authority have you arrested him? Set Jesus free. This provokes a general murmur among the onlookers, which grows into a louder commotion. The soldiers tighten their ranks even more. Some of the onlookers RUSH the soldiers are met with LASHING WHIPS. Confused confrontation, JESUS looks utterly calm, though His bruised face shows t effect of the blows he has suffered. Hidden in the PEN, JUDAS TEARS AT HIMSELF with ferocity. LAMBS leap about, frightened by him as well as by the tor and brouhaha that’s broken out on the road. The SILVER in JUDAS’ hands is COVERED IN BLOOD. The sight of it confuse him, He WHEEZES, SHRIEKS and races off into the darkness, toward the city walls. The LAMBS scatter to keep away fro him and race toward the FENCE where they STOP, stare at t procession on the road. JESUS sees them. The small animals step their bleating an exchange with Him a moment of recognition.

INT, HELI’S HOUSE IN JERUSALEM, LAST SUPPER. NIGHT. The head of a tiny LAMB is held by a YOUNG MAN. JESUS, surrounded by His Apostles, is handed a SHARP KNIFE. With QUICK, SOLEMN, MOVEMENTS He makes a SMALL INCISION IN THE LAMB’s NECK. The gesture is short and the cut swift and t JESUS then hands the knife to the YOUNG MAN, who complete the act of killing the lamb. The blood flows in the basin next to the lamb’s head. JESUS is handed a BRANCH of HYSS which he DIPS into the basin. He then hangs the branch ab the door to the room.

His face almost unrecognizable, JESUS looks UP at the TEM DOORS, DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HIM. The PROCESSION has come stop. JESUS lowers his eyes and slowly SCANS some of the faces outside the Temple, There is a considerable CROWD gathered here. We recognize some of those who were summoned earlier by Temple Guards.

location: STREET PARALLEL TO TEMPLE WALLS. NIGHT.

head_text.subj: WE MOVE BACK QUICKLY, DOWN A STREET WHICH RUNS ALONGSIDE
TEMPLE WALLS UNTIL WE SLOW DOWN AND COME TO A HALT.

text: JUDAS stumbles along the deserted street. He STOPS as the door to a house OPENS. He tries to hide. Impossible. CAIPHAS, followed by a half-dozen accolytes, emerges. He is dressed in rich, impressive ceremonial robes. JUDAS’ eyes widen, He stares down at the string of SILVER COINS in his hand, whimpers, lifts his eyes to CAIPHAS wh striding off, utterly ignoring him. JUDAS rushes toward the High Priest, who stops, turns. Two GUARDS step between the two men, swords drawn.
No, Let him pass. He’s harmless... JUDAS slows, approaches, holds out the string of coins.
(words catching in his throat) You bribed me and I betrayed him. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

JUDAS (cont'd) Let him go. Release him. He is a just man. Take back your silver. Here, take it. But he doesn’t let go of the silver. CAIPHAS is motionless, eyes unblinking, patient. JUDAS (cont'd) He is innocent. Take back your silver, I don’t want it. HERE...TAKE IT! The echo of his shout bounces off the walls of the narrow street. CAIPHAS waits another beat, then:

If you think you sold innocent blood to us, Judas, that is your affair. We know what we have bought. You have your money, now go! CAIPHAS is distracted by lights and CROWD NOISES at the e of the street, near the Temple entrance. JUDAS, too, looks. Then their eyes meet. With a BELLOW of impotent rage, JUDAS tears apart the string of coins in h hands and THROWS these at CAIPHAS. The coins bounce off t opulent robes, to the ground. JUDAS then RUNS down the empty street toward the torchlit CROWD which is now visible. CAIPHAS and his retinue ignore the silver coins as they rattle musically and settle on the cobblestones. They exchange quick looks of indifference, then continue towar the lights and the people.

location: SIDE STREET NEAR JERUSALEM TEMPLE. NIGHT.

text: In the relative DARKNESS of the side street, JOHN reaches arm back and stops when he reaches the corner onto the wi street. MARY and MAGDALEN are behind him. He peers at the CROWD before the TEMPLE. Then his eyes FREEZE, cur TO: EXT. WIDER STREET AT TEMPLE ENTRANCE. JERUSALEM. NIGHT. JUDAS’ bloody face is contorted with pain. He is dirty, dishevelled and his entire body TWITCHES uncontrollably. (CONTINUED)
TWO MEN wearing HOODED ROBES, stand in front of him. He w his arms about, frantically, as he addresses them.
You will wander, Judas, always.
Cursed and cursing. Always.
How...do you mean. ..ALWAYS?
Your betrayal has entered you, Judas, like water into your entrails.
Like oil into your bones.

NO! Get away from me, GO! Leave me! He starts to HIT the two HOODED MEN, arms flailing, face twisted into a mask of wide-eyed horror. cur TO: EXT. SIDE STREET NEAR JERUSALEM TEMPLE. NIGHT. JOHN has not moved from the street corner. He shakes his head, MAGDALEN and MARY step forward, past him, but they, too, stop when they see:

JUDAS standing near the corner of the two streets, his ar FLAILING, moaning and crying out as he punches the EMPTY in front of him. There is nobody there to hit. Behind him, across the wider street, the TEMPLE DOORS are “visible, and the CROWD gathered around the TORCHES. MARY’s focus has MOVED PAST the unsettling image of JUDAS onto CAIPHAS who is now approaching with his retinue of Pharisees. JUDAS, too, sees CAIPHAS approach. He turns, RUNS then se JOHN, MARY and MAGDALEN and STOPS, trapped. JOHN, MARY and MAGDALEN take a step toward him. He looks back, doesn’t know what to do, where to go. Cornered, helpless, JUDAS watches the three approach, their eyes seeming to bore holes into and THROUGH HIM. (CONTINUED)
Smet

They are nearly face to face before JUDAS realizes that J MARY and MAGDALEN are NOT SEEING HIM, that their eyes are EXCLUSIVELY FOCUSED on what is happening behind him, at t entrance to the Temple. He staggers to the curb, falls to ground and watches them walk right by him. The CROWD has parted for CAIPHAS as he approaches the Tem doors. First the SOLDIERS are revealed, then JESUS, stand in their midst, tied up, shackled, bleeding, bruised yet motionless and dignified. The Temple doors are OPENED by the attendants of a SECOND HIGH PRIEST (ANNAS) who’s in the COURTYARD, surrounded by OTHER PRELATES and ELDERS, all wearing formal robes. The CROWD raises a loud CHEER as CAIPHAS enters the court with his retinue. JESUS turns. His eyes meet JOHN’s, MAGDALEN'’s and finall MARY’s. Then he is SHOVED brutally forward, through the d and into the OPEN COURTYARD just inside. The CROWD cheers again, louder and obviously for EFFECT a TWO ROMAN SOLDIERS ride up on HORSEBACK. The CROWD surges forward, fixing to enter the Temple grou but is STOPPED by Temple GUARDS posted outside. The DOORS however, are kept open. MAGDALEN moans. She and MARY hold on to JOHN’s clothes as PUSHES his way past the crowd toward the doors. They don’ see PETER, behind them, also elbowing his way forward. As JOHN reaches the GUARDS, PETER reaches their side, sweati and breathing hard.

Peter...oh, Peter... He opens his burly arms and MARY enters PETER’s embrace. PETER and JOHN exchange a look of shared helpless misery MAGDALEN has turned to the two ROMAN HORSEMEN and PUSHES WAY BACK TOWARD THEM, THROUGH THE CROWD OF PEOPLE. They s her, wait on their horses. When she reaches them, she lif her tear~-ravaged, yet beautiful face to them. The TWO CENTURIONS seem mesmerized by her.
INT. ROMAN GOVERNOR’S PALACE. NIGHT. The room is nearly bare of furniture. A bed, a low table which sits a mirror, a few chairs. Only a weak oil lamp illuminates the bedroom. (CONTINUED)

In the bed a WOMAN sleeps (CLAUDIA PROCLES, PILATE’s wife It is a restless sleep. She tosses, turns, moans. KR FIGURE enters the room and walks up to the bed. It is (PONTIUS PILATE) wearing a simple garment and a cloak dra over one shoulder. He moves silently and, when he reaches bedside his face is illuminated. A short, tubular man wit well-groomed weak face. CLAUDIA moans, lets out a short CRY and, in her sleep, be to weep. PILATE is distressed at the sight. He reaches a out to her. A NOISE stops him. He turns. Standing by the to the bedroom is a ROMAN CENTURION, his helmet under his arm, PILATE glances at CLAUDIA, concerned, then strides t the door and motions the CENTURION to exit with him. cur TO: INT. PILATE’S PALACE. NIGHT.

text: (low) I thought I instructed you never to disturb me if I am with...

(interrupts) With apologies, Your Excellency...but there is trouble brewing amongst the Jews. It seems that Caiphas and Annas have had one of their so-called prophets arrested. A large crowd has assembled in and around the Temple...
Prophet? What sort of prophet?
One of their itinerant magicians, Your Excellency, only...this man seems to have a large following of disciples.

Why take him to the temple if he is just another common trickster? The two men do not see or hear the DOOR TO CLAUDIA’s BEDR open. CLAUDIA, dressed in a light gown, looking HAUNTED, stands in the dark room, barely visible. (CONTINUED)
He is a Galilean. The Pharisees and Sadducees apparently hate the man.
A Galilean? Who are you talking about? Who has been taken to the Temple? Startled, the men turn to face her.

In the Temple COURTYARD the soldiers who arrested JESUS a relieved of their duties ~- change of Guards. A DOOR into the Temple Halls is opened and the Priests and Elder enter the building. Next to the GUARDS’ BARRACKS in the open courtyard a ROUG AWNING has been erected, inside of which CARPENTERS BUSIL WORK on various-sized TRUNKS OF LUMBER. OTHER MEN DUMP TO and other METALLIC OBJECTS onto low tables. JESUS looks exhausted by the long march from Gethsemani. A TEMPLE SOLDIER who was not part of the arrest party now strides up to JESUS, unties His hands and brusquely lifts bleeding, dirty, swollen face. JESUS’ eyes are clear and calm. The OFFICER cannot stand to look into them. He SLAP JESUS hard across the face, and leans forward,

A magician, they say. Tt say a charlatan. The soldiers all around fall silent, watch the exchange. JESUS does not reply. His eyes meet the man’s and the OFF loses his composure and, this time strikes JESUS with his FIST and CONTINUES TO HIT HIM as: OFFICER (cont! d) You’ re FINISHED! Whatever you think, whoever THEY (points) believe you are is gone, good as forgotten...dead. The men around the Courtyard burst into coarse jeers. At the DOORS to the Temple, despite PETER’s attempts to stop her, MAGDALEN screams over their jeers:
STOP! FOR MERCY’S SAKE, STOP IT! MY
(CONTINUED)

JOHN tries to cover her mouth, but MAGDALEN abruptly goes quiet. JOHN follows her gaze, JESUS has turned to her. Eyes glued to His, MAGDALEN now MOANS. Her hands search t air, find MARY’s, they CLASP. JESUS is led INSIDE THE TEMPLE. PETER is whispering into the ears of one of the GUARDS wh putting some coins into the man’s hands. The GUARD lets P through, along with a number of others. JOHN, MARY and MAGDALEN try to follow PETER but they are STOPPED by the GUARD.

location: GREAT HALL. TEMPLE IN JERUSALEM. NIGHT.

text: PETER moves along with others, toward the bright torchlit HALL where CAIPHAS, ANNAS and the other Priests and ELDER are seated. The hall is filled to capacity. JESUS stands small clearing at the center of the hall, His hands tied behind His back, His garment torn and filthy, His face pa swollen and bloody. ANNAS pretends to look surprised at the sight of JESUS, a exchanges ironic smiles with CATPHAS and others.
Who is this vagabond you bring to us, chained like a man condemned to death? One of the GUARDS. shouts:
He is Jesus, the rebel of Nazareth. All voices at once quiet down. ANNAS stands, approaches.

Is it true? YOU are Jesus of Nazareth? He looks away from JESUS’ eyes, scans His torn clothes an bloodied face, arms and feet: ANNAS (cont’d) The people, it seems, have decided to put a stop to your blasphemous conduct toward God and his priests. ANNAS turns to the chosen audience. Silence. He waits, glances at CAIPHAS, raises his eyebrows. It’s a signal. (CONTINUED)
Tentative jeers and sneers and hissings. PETER, worried, moves to the front row, closer to JESUS. JESUS lifts His head to look at ANNAS. The crowd falls Silent, as abruptly as it began the hissing.

I have spoken openly to the world. I have taught in the Synagogue, and in the Temple, where all Jews gather. I have never spoken in secret, But why ask me? Ask those who have heard what I have to say. They know, and will be able to answer you. Silence. CAIPHAS slowly rises from his seat and strides up to JESU His voice is low, but it carries in the silence.

Is that how you address yourself to a High Priest? With MALICE and IRONY? CAIPHAS steps back, glances at a large, BRUTISH GUARD who steps forward and hits JESUS on the side of His face with HILT of his sword. JESUS falls to His knees.

Between JOHN and MAGDALEN, MARY’s HEAD SNAPS BACK, as if had been HIT ON HER FACE. She CRUMBLES to her knees. MAGDALEN and JOHN both kneel down beside her. JOHN lifts face. There is a huge BRUISE on the side of her face. MAR unconscious, The BRUISE mysteriously retreats, then VANISHES. JOHN and MAGDALEN exchange looks and turn anguished faces toward the Temple. WE MOVE now, PAST the GUARD into the Temple COURTYARD, THROUGH the doors, INTO the GREAT HALL where: INT. GREAT HALL. TEMPLE IN JERUSALEM. NIGHT. JESUS slowly gets back to His feet. More jeering, sneering and hissing by the Elders, Scribes Pharisees, Sadducees and many in the audience. PETER shut his eyes and becomes motionless. (CONTINUED)
Vom 26.
JESUS looks at the BRUTISH GUARD who hit him.
If I have spoken evil, tell me what evil I have spoken. If not, why do you strike me? CAIPHAS motions the GUARD away. ANNAS, beside him, raises arms in the air and the audience quiets down.
They say you are a king...where is your kingdom? JESUS turns to CAIPHAS, but does not answer.

Which order of kings do you descend from? Speak up. CAIPHAS and ANNAS start to spit out questions at JESUS. Rhetorical questions, for they don’t give him time to ans As they do, we move AMONG the CROWD in the hall.
Aren't you the son of an obscure carpenter?

Some say you are Elias. I thought he was carried to heaven in a chariot. One of the men standing beside PETER notices PETER’s stillness, that he is holding his eyes closed. The man studies him with suspicion, then leans in and mutters:

Haven’t I seen you in the company of the Galilean? Yes, you are one of his disciples, I know it, I recognize you. PETER is shaken. Other turn to him, curious. The crowd is tightly packed PETER can barely move. Panic. He pushes hi way toward the rear of the crowd, shaking his head. A WOMAN IN THE AUDIENCE now peers at him and points:
Wait. Stay where you are. You are Peter, one of the disciples of Jesus. (CONTINUED)

(harsh whisper) Quiet, woman. I never met that man. I do not know him. The DENSE crowd of men and women around PETER suddenly SHIFTS, as more people SQUEEZE into the GREAT HALL. The S of a ROOSTER CROWING enters the hall as well. PETER is PU FORWARD, and again stands close to the center where JESUS being pestered by CAIPHAS, ANNAS, other ‘witnesses’ and ‘accusers’. Each of them either SPITS at JESUS or THROWS something at Him as they speak.
Cures the sick by wizardry. With the help of devils.
He casts out devils with the help of devils. Laughter greets the absurdity of that, CAIPHAS glances at ANNAS, clearly upset. More laughter.
Calls himself king of the Jews.
Not true! He calls himself son of God!

Wrong! You’re both wrong. The bread of life. That’s what he said he is. Whoever doesn’t eat his flesh or drink his blood will not have eternal life. PETER’s eyes meet those of JESUS. The LOOK of SORROW and affection he sees causes PETER to lower his head.

The Great Hall quiets down, the crowd becomes still. CALPHAS (cont’d) You are ALL OF YOU under this man’s evil spell, contradicting each other like so many fools. Offer us PROOF of his wrongdoing, or else be quiet. CAIPHAS and ANNAS scan the throng of confused faces. They all looking at JESUS. CAIPHAS turns to look also. (CONTINUED)

JESUS is motionless, head bowed, silent. The HISSING and SHOUTING begin again, with renewed intens spurred by the silence and stillness of JESUS. An OLD MAN (JOSEPH of ARIMATHEA) steps forward, hushes th crowd, turns solemn eyes to CAIPHAS and ANNAS.

This entire proceeding is offensive, Caiphas. I have heard nothing from these so-called witnesses but false accusation, dissention, contradiction. The speed with which you've assembled this Tribunal is, in my view, further evidence of malice. Yours and theirs. A number of men nod in agreement, cover their heads in a gesture of disapproval. Some simply LEAVE the Tribunal. Most, however, erupt into loud jeers. They start to push JOSEPH and some of the other dissenters around, then literally SHOVE them out the door. JESUS watches his few supporters leave or be thrown out. CAIPHAS is filled with secret pleasure as JOSEPH and the good men leave the TRIBUNAL. As soon as they are gone, he turns to JESUS again. The noise dies down.

Have you nothing to say, then? No answer to any of these accusations? JESUS neither moves nor answers. One of the more VICIOUS of the men surrounding Him grabs JESUS by the hair and YANKS His head backward. The eyes o JESUS now look directly into those of CAIPHAS.
I ask you now, Jesus of Nazareth, to tell us if you are the Christ, the Messiah, Son of the living God.
You have said it. As he speaks, LIGHT suddenly envelops Him. This causes CAIPHAS to look away. JESUS scans the faces of the men surrounding Him, then faces CAIPHAS once more. (CONTINUED)

JESUS {cont’d) I am the Christ, Son of the living God A SHOCK-WAVE of complete silence. CAIPHAS steps away from JESUS as if he had been slapped. The majority of the Pharisees, Scribes and Sadducees in t Tribunal ERRUPT into a DEAFENING CLAMOR. CAIPHAS takes hold of his rich MANTLE with one hand and, grabbing a SWORD from one of the soldiers, RENTS the MANT IN HALF.

BLASPHEMY! (points to Jesus) You all heard him. He has committed blasphemy. Why bother with witnesses? You heard what he said...what is your verdict? The PANDEMONIUM which CEASED for a moment explodes with renewed energy as the Pharisees shout in unison:

The ECHO OF THAT SHOUT FILLS THE HALL and, like a ripple wave, moves OUTWARD, through the doors into the COURTYARD OUT THE TEMPLE DOORS where: EXT. TEMPLE DOORS. JERUSALEM. NIGHT. The DENSE CROWD is caught up in the FRENZY which has erru inside the Temple, MARY is still UNCONSCIOUS. JOHN and MAGDALEN CROUCH by he side, protecting her from the packed mob around them. As the sudden WAVE of CHEERS ERRUPTS all around them, MAR wakes up VERY ABRUPTLY. Before JOHN or MAGDALEN have time react, she SCRAMBLES to her feet and tries to get past th throng and INTO the Temple grounds.

(feverish, her head shaking) No. No. No... JOHN rushes to stop her. MAGDALEN remains where she is, on her knees, slightly dishevelled, incapable of making a sound. Her dry-eyed, silent and ferocious denial is heart~breaking. (CONTINUED)

JOHN reaches MARY and gently restrains her. She turns to at him, intensely pale, anguished. Her words catch in her throat, she is almost incapable of breathing. MARY (cont’d) John...they are going to...he is condemned! Oh, do you not hear it? His blessed heart, John...beating! Her face collapses into tears. Holding her, JOHN looks ov people’s heads toward the door into the Great Hall. EXT. VALLEY OF HINNOM. NIGHT. JUDAS runs across a desolate landscape, a man possessed. groans, breathlessly. His clothes have been mostly torn o his back and his bare skin looks pale and dirty. The light of the moon suddenly fills the night. He stops, looks over his shoulders at the walls of JERUSALEM. A BLAST OF WIND HITS JUDAS, then silence and stillness descend on the valley around him. An EERIE quiet. JUDAS SCREAMS. He is staring at the SKIN on his PALE FORE which HAS SWOLLEN INTO AN ODD SHAPE. JUDAS TRIES TO COVER SWELLING with his other hand, but he CANNOT. It MOVES. He tries again and the swelling moves OUT OF REACH. Frantic JUDAS begins to TEAR at his own skin, but HOWEVER HARD HE TRIES TO GRAB HOLD of the KNOB, IT FVADES HIS TOUCH. His watery eyes, bloody face, torn hair and twisted face pres a mask of self-inflicted torment. His screams bloodcurdli JUDAS struggles to TEAR OUT the mysterious GROWTH as it travels about his body, always out of reach, alternating between HOWLS of rage and fear and breathless, wretched silences. Suddenly he stops and GAPES AT THE MOON through the branc of a sturdy, tall tree. Then he SPINS around. The TWO FACELESS, HOODED FIGURES with whom he battled ear are approaching. They stop. Stillness.
They have reached a verdict, Judas, They are going to put him to death. JUDAS is and remains motionless.
You sold him. You know the law... (CONTINUED)
Se
He who sells a soul among his brothers and receives the price of it...
Let him die the death. Silence. Then JUDAS rasps, like a cicada.

The death? He looks at the tall tree branches, at the moon, shuts hi eyes. From beneath his eyelids spring bitter tears, cut To: INT. TRIBUNAL HALL. TEMPLE. NIGHT. Pandemonium, at the center of which stands JESUS, His composure in sharp contrast to the frenzy around Him. CAIPHAS and ANNAS, surrounded by the Elder Scribes, watch the crowd SWARM around JESUS like wasps, some PULLING at hair, or His beard and ripping away fingerfuls of it, oth SPITTING at HIM or HITTING HIM with their hands or with sticks.
PETER’s eyes fill with anguish. He roughly ELBOWS away a number of the more violent in the crowd. His efforts are noticed by one of the Elders.

Look! There. Who is that man? That one, yes...why is he interfering? A number of threatening faces now focus on PETER, who retreats, tries to blend in with the frenzied horde. A nu of HANDS now reach out and GRAB HOLD OF HIS TUNIC.
You’re one of his disciples, aren’t you? One of his Galilean heretics. PETER shakes his head violently and tries to get loose.
No, You are mistaken. I am not a disciple. I do not even know the man. “ A momentary reprieve as a new set of GUARDS enter the H carrying BUNDLES with them. (CONTINUED)

PETER pushes and claws his way toward the exit. The NEW GUARDS gruffly separate the people from JESUS. Th want. Him for themselves. The first thing they do is PRES Him with a CROWN of STRAW, which they place on His head a they TEAR OFF His robe and scapular, throw an OLD, TORN MANTLE over His shoulders and hang a LONG IRON CHAIN arou His neck, STUDDED with sharp points which TEAR at His fle as they DRAG HIM AROUND the Great Hall.
Behold the Son of David, wearing the crown of his father! Faces pop up before PETER’s as he PUSHES against the rest Then a SECOND MAN GRABS PETER’s TUNIC.
Hold it...stop! I’ve seen you before, Yes, now I remember! On the road to Gethsemani! You’re the one who cut off Malchus’ ear with a sword! Claustrophobic panic overcomes Peter.

No, No, you are wrong. I do not know what you are talking about. I swear, I do not know the man, believe me. He TUGS at his mantle with a surge of FURY and fear, PULL FREE and ELBOWS his way OUT into the COURTYARD. IN THE COURTYARD: Peter stumbles as far away from the doo into the Great Hall as he can. As soon as he is alone, he HEARS a ROOSTER CROWING.
PETER is walking beside JESUS on the path which separates GETHSEMANI from the GARDEN OF OLIVES. The rest of the APOSTLES (all except JUDAS) are walking behind them. Only JOHN keeps pace.
Not I, Master, no. I will always be faithful to you. JESUS stops and turns to PETER (CONTINUED)
Simon, Simon...I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail you, because where I am going you may not follow me.
{enthusiastically interrupts) Lord, I tell you I am ready to follow you wherever you may go...to prison, even to death, JESUS rests a hand on PETER’s shoulder
Amen, amen, Simon, I say to you before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.

PETER turns his eyes to the roof of the COURTYARD where a ROOSTER perches, crowing with vigor. PETER covers his face with his hands. A ROAR from inside the Great Hall. MAGNETICALLY drawn to is taking place, terrified by the mania inside, deeply ashamed of himself, PETER edges his way back to the door tries to see what is happening inside.
CAIPHAS interrupts what has become a sadistic frenzy.

March this king of straw to the Temple dungeon and keep him there until we can present him to the Roman Governor! The delirious, bloodthirsty crowd help the soldiers DRAG JESUS QUT of the Great Hall, putting on a boisterous show deference to His royalty. They PASS VERY NEAR TO PETER, and JESUS looks directly at Apostle as He is dragged by. PETER’s eyes fill with tears covers his head with his hood, trying to hide his misery steps back into the shadows in the Hall. JESUS is taken OUT of the GREAT HALL, then THROUGH an adjacent door and DOWN a NARROW FLIGHT OF STAIRS.  Nee 34. INT. TEMPLE DUNGEON. NIGHT. Rat-infested, dank and barely illuminated, the DUNGEON is a vaulted foundation directly UNDER the Great Hall. The GUARDS CHAIN JESUS to a METAL RING hanging HIGH on a GRIM WALL. He is stretched to the point where only His toes to the filthy ground. JESUS lowers His head, exhausted. The GUARDS retreat. Darkness. cuT TO: EXT. TEMPLE COURTYARD. NIGHT. The CROWD of PHARISEES, SADDUCEES, Elders, Scribes and fa witnesses POURS OUT OF the Great Hall and makes its noisy toward the street, outside the TEMPLE DOORS, MARY, JOHN and MAGDALEN are the ONLY ONES moving against tide of people going the opposite way. No one takes any notice of them, not even the GUARDS. Finally they are alo in the COURTYARD, just outside the Great Hall door. INSIDE THE GREAT HALL, the only figure is that of PETER, HIS KNEES NOW, SOBBING uncontrollably and BANGING HIS FOREHEAD onto the bloodsoaked stone floor. ENTERING the now SEMI~DARK Hall, JOHN, MARY and MAGDALEN stop when they see PETER, not sure who he could be. PETER’s SOBS ring out in the emptiness, then:
Peter? PETER stops, but as yet does not turn. MARY steps forward.

Peter...is it truly you, Simon? PETER gets to his feet too quickly, spins around, face crushed into a mask of deep shame and misery. MARY stops. MARY (cont’d) Where is my son? Where have they taken him? Tell me what has happened to Jesus? Where is he, Peter? PETER scans their faces, then faces MARY once more but remains silent, MARY takes a step toward him: (CONTINUED)
MARY (cont’d) Peter, why do you not answer me? PETER’s face undergoes fracture, as does his voice.

NO! Mother, please, I beg you, do not speak to me. I am unworthy, Mary, unworthy...your son is suffering more than words can express. The Pharisees have condemned him to death, and T...1I have denied him three times! MAGDALEN cries out. It echoes in the Great Hall. PETER ru past MARY, JOHN and Magdalen, out of the Hall. MARY has become still, in the center of the room, where J stood. She has SHUT her eyes as PETER ran past her. Now s re-opens them and LOWERS HER EYES TO THE FLOOR. The STILLNESS of the room INTENSIFIES as the STONE FLOOR becomes TRANSPARENT TO MARY. BENEATH the spot where she is standing is the DARK, AIRLE DUNGEON CELL WHERE JESUS TS TIED AND CHAINED TO THE WALL.

head_text.subj: DESPITE THE DARKNESS, HIS BLOOD ENCRUSTED HANDS, FACE AND
FEET ARE PLAINLY VISIBLE TO HER,

text: He stands immobile, His head lowered. MARY moans. JESUS L HIS FACE and LOOKS UP. It is as if both of them can see e other THROUGH THE STONE FLOOR, and THERE TS A MOMENT OF SILENT COMMUNION BETWEEN THEM.

head_text.subj: MARY COLLAPSES ON THE COLD STONE,

text: cur To: EXT. VALLEY OF HINNOM. NIGHT. The SOUND OF BONE SNAPPING accompanies the sudden DROP of body from a THICK, TALL BRANCH of the tree. Lifeless now, JUDAS swings from a rope tied to the tall branch of a tree and around his neck. Silence. Empty, dark, Godless silence. Then the body of JUDAS BURSTS OPEN, as if exploding, and Scatters in putrefaction on the ground beneath the tree. Qn the HORIZON, the first glimmer of dawn light.
(CONTINUED)

EXT. PILATE’S PALACE. JERUSALEM. DAWN. The face of JESUS is pale under the blood, sweat and grim his night-ordeal. In chains again, He is dragged along th wide street toward the Roman Governor's Palace. CAIPHAS, ANNAS, the SANHEDRIM of ELDERS and OTHER SCRIBES lead the GUARDS surrounding JESUS. The STREET is LINED with people pushing each other out of way so they can have a better look at the procession. Despite His appalling condition, JESUS carries Himself wi calm majesty. MARY, MAGDALEN, JOHN and the other women stand behind som the onlookers.

{under her breath) My Jesus. My son... CAIPHAS and the SANHEDRIM have reached the gates into the Palace grounds. A CENTURION has stopped them. CAIPHAS tur and watches JESUS being dragged toward them as one of the Elders whispers to the CENTURION. CcUuT TO: INT. ROMAN GOVERNOR'S PALACE. NIGHT. A TRUMPET SOUNDS, in the near distance, muted by walls. PILATE is being helped into a ceremonial ROMAN OFFICER’s uniform. CLAUDIA is seated nearby. PILATE dismisses his servant, then approaches her and kisses her lightly. The SOUND OF FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING THEIR ROOM.
Do not condemn the man. He is a holy man, you would only bring trouble down on yourself.
What would you have me do, Claudia?
He is Galilean. Give him to the King of Galilee, te Herod. Let HIM be the one to pass judgement. (CONT INUED)
PILATE is silent. He studies his wife’s face distractedly
(thoughtful, hesitant) Clever Claudia. Herod is living in adultery, and is considered a great Sinner even by the Jewish priests. If he condemns this,,..

His name is Jesus. If Herod condemns him, and the Jewish High Priests do as he commands, they’re the ones who will be committing a crime. There is a KNOCK on the door and the CENTURION enters. PI smiles reassuringly at CLAUDIA and exits. cuT TO: INT, PRAETORIUM, PILATE’S PALACE. MORNING. JESUS stands alone at the foot of the flight of stairs. S of the chains have been removed from Him, as well as some the ropes, though His hands are still bound. He keeps His head low, which hides most of the SWELLING o His face. CAIPHAS, ANNAS and the elder SCRIBES and other members of Sandhedrim takes their places. Behind them, the CROWD gathers in the open FORUM. PILATE enters, walks toward his lone seat on a terrace overlooking the Praetorium. All noise stops. PILATE gazes down at JESUS at the foot of the flight of stairs, then a the gathered Priests and people. He frowns, unhappily: PILATE looks at JESUS again. JESUS does not move. PILATE, (cont’d) Do you always half-kill your prisoners before they are even judged guilty? A second hush. CAIPHAS steps forward, starts to speak but PILATE (cont‘d) What accusations do you bring against this man?
If he were not a malefactor we would not have brought him before you.
Why don’t you judge him according to your laws?
Consul, you know it is unlawful for us to condemn any man to death.
To death!? You would condemn this man to death? What has he done to deserve such harsh judgement?

He has violated our Sabbath, Consul. Profaned the day of God by curing the sick, even on that day. PILATE motions the ROMAN GUARDS to bring JESUS up the sta to the platform, then walks up to JESUS and studies Him w curiosity. He signals to the GUARD to cut the ropes bindi Him, then looks down at CAIPHAS, irony dancing in his Rom eyes.

You were not ill yourself on that day, Caiphas, or you would not complain that he was curing you on a Sabbath. The CROWD is both shocked and amused by PILATE’s words. JESUS remains motionless behind PILATE. CAIPHAS is furious, and embarrassed.
He has seduced the people by teaching them disgusting doctrines.
Disgusting, no less. For example?
He has said that no person can attain eternal life unless they eat his flesh and drink his blood. PILATE glances back at JESUS.
You must all be very eager to attain eternal life...judging by the way you thirst for his body and his blood.
More laughter. CAIPHAS is livid. He turns and consults in undertones with ANNAS and some of the elders and SCRIBES.
(raises his voice) He has forbidden his disciples to pay tribute to the emperor, Consul! PILATE is studying JESUS with undiminished curiosity. His face hardens, he slowly turns around.

How could I have come up with such a question by myself? Am I a Jew? Your High Priests have delivered you to me, They want me to have you executed. Why? What have you done? (CONTINUED)

This man is a Galilean, is he not?
(smells a trap, hesitates) He is...

Well, then he is a subject of King Herod's. His Majesty is in Jerusalem for the Pasch...let him judge the man according to the laws of Galilee. He waves at the ROMAN GUARDS, who take hold of JESUS and march Him down the flight of stairs. PILATE watches as JE is delivered back into the hands of the PHARISEES, PUT in CHAINS and dragged out. The PRAETORIUM quickly empties of the people. PILATE is a to turn away when a FIGURE appears at the entrance to the PRAETORIUM below. CLAUDIA. Silence. PILATE is clearly troubled.
(soft) What is truth, Claudia? Do you hear it when it is spoken?
(soft) Yes, I do. (quick beat) Don’t you? Beat.
(shakes his head) Can you tell me?
(low) No. If you will not hear the truth, no one can tell you. PILATE turns away, impatiently, and exits. (CONTINUED)

CLAUDIA’s eyes fill with tears. A soft noise. She looks. MARY, JOHN and MAGDALEN stand in the shadow of one of the PRAETORIUM columns, motionless. After a brief moment, CLAUDIA steps up toward the JUDGEME PLATFORM, At the top, she turns and looks down at where M JOHN and MAGDALEN were, but they are no longer there. CLA is no longer weeping. CUT TO; INT. HEROD’S PALACE. MORNING. A spacious, opulently decorated hall filled with cushions gilded furniture. KING HEROD half-sits, half~lies on a so of THRONE of CUSHIONS. He is an effeminate man of soft, forgettable features. A slippery spirit. He stands and glides toward JESUS, studies Him briefly th turns and shouts hysterically at the PHARISEES.

You miserable butchers! How dare you bring this man to me in such a state! Take him away, clean him up! JESUS is dragged out of the THRONE ROOM. EXT. COURTYARD, HEROD’'S PALACE. MORNING. JESUS’ CHAINS are removed by the Temple GUARDS, who then proceed to EMPTY BUCKETS of cold water over JESUS. This removes the worst of the blood, sweat and mud from Him. Some ROMAN SOLDIERS enter the yard from the Palace Gates watch with pity and contempt. Behind the Romans MARY, JOHN and MAGDALEN enter the courtyard, stop, look on in shock, With a cry of anger MAGDALEN rushes in, KNOCKS one down.

No! The water has spilled over the upended GUARD. FURIOUS, he looks up at her with unabashed hatred, but although MAGDA stands over the man, she now sees only JESUS, removes her cape from her shoulders and hands it to Him. JESUS is DRENCHED. His clothes are sopping wet. (CONTINUED)

MAGDALEN has managed to enfold His face in the dry cotton her cape when one of the ROMAN SOLDIERS steps in, GRABS MAGDALEN by her arms and FORCIBLY transports her back to where MARY and JOHN are standing. The ROMAN SOLDIERS then force the three to EXIT the courtyard. MARY turns as she led out to the street. MARY’S POV: JESUS is dragged to the Palace doors by the Temple GUARDS
INT. HEROD’S HALL. MORNING. HEROD ignores the gathered PHARISEES as he watches JESUS standing before him at the center of the hall. The guards back off.

(softly) Jesus of Nazareth, Miracle worker. JESUS neither acknowledges nor even looks at him. HEROD (cont’d) You are silent. Have you no answer to all the accusations these men have brought against you? Silence, Stiliness. HEROD (cont'd) Will you work a miracle for me? Say something and confound these men! HEROD scans the faces of CAIPHAS, ANNAS and the ELDERS. H laughs to himself, foppishly. HEROD (cont’d) Confound them with a miracle, then. The tension in the hall increases as JESUS ignores HEROD. HEROD (cont‘d) Are you the one whose birth was foretold? Answer me. Are you a king? He paces around, both drawn to and now afraid of JESUS. HEROD (cont’d) Is it true that you restore sight to the blind?
(CONTINUED)

HEROD (cont’d) Feed thousands with only a few loaves of bread? Is it true that you raised Lazarus from the dead? Who are you? Where does your power come from? Beat. HEROD (cont’d) Where has it gone? HEROD glances at the members of the SANHEDRIM as he paces back and forth in front of JESUS. He stops, peers at the of JESUS, who does not react or even look at him. HEROD steps back, intimidated, and snaps petulantly: HEROD (cont’d) Ach! Take this fool out of my sight! He is guilty of no crime, He’s just mad! Pay him the homage that is due a madman...no more than that! HEROD then watches with a spoiled frown on his soft face the GUARDS move forward and CHAIN JESUS down again, As they exit HEROD’s Hall:
All we can do is bring him back to Pilate. We cannot kill him.

Not officially, no... ANNAS takes this in, scans the faces around them. All of turn to watch JESUS as he is DRAGGED from the hall. ANNAS turns to a particularly large, BRUTISH MAN among th GUARDS. Their eyes meet, ever so briefly. ANNAS nods. The large GUARD walks toward the GUARDS who are marching JESU out, mutters a few words to them. Electricity among the conspirators. Fire of hatred.

EXT. COURTYARD OF HEROD‘'S PALACE. MORNING. As JESUS steps out into the Palace Courtyard the GUARDS K HIM TO THE GROUND, TIE HIS ANKLES WITH ROPES and DRAG HIM ALONG the yard’s GUTTER. His HEAD REPEATEDLY SMASHES agai stone columns that line the gutter. This is obviously mea to KILL JESUS, but when they stop, He RAISES HIMSELF back His feet, face covered with blood. (CONTINUED)
CAIPHAS turns to ANNAS and the rest of the ELDERS and, despite himself, studies JESUS with admiration:
Well, it’s the law, after all...we may not put a man to death. Not unless a Roman Governor has condemned him. CAIPHAS strides up to JESUS, examines the bloody face bef him, then SPITS.

A MAN (SIMON OF CYRENE) walks toward an enclosed GARDEN, accompanied by THREE CHILDREN. SIMON enters the GARDEN ju as a BAND of people RUSH PAST HIM, excitedly. SIMON warily watches the crowd, then rushes back to get h children off the street, away from the throng. When he se one of the herd move more slowly than the rest:
What is going on...?
They’ ve arrested Jesus of Nazareth. King Herod has condemned him to death but his disciples are appealing to the Romans to set him free... SIMON shrugs, turns to his children safely in the garden.
EXT. GARDEN OF ROMAN GOVERNON’R PALACE. MORNING. PILATE stands before a shrine to a Roman god. His ever- present OFFICER is standing behind him.
We are going to need reinforcements.
I...don’t want to start a rebellion.
A rebellion has already started, sir.
You say they are bringing this... prophet back here? Why? (CONTINUED)
Herod has refused to condemn the man. A SOLDIER appears, out of breath. PILATE and the OFFICER to him.

INT. JUDGEMENT PLATFORM. PILATE’S PALACE. MORNING PILATE strides onto the judgement platform and sits on th lone seat. Below, the CROWD is DOUBLE THE SIZE IT WAS EARLIER - MORE RESTLESS, LOUDER, MORE UNPREDICTABLE. CAIPHAS, ANNAS and the members of the SANHEDRIM enter. JESUS staggers into the praetorium and COLLAPSES on the floor, bloodied, filthy, in obvious pain, exhausted. Inst of helping Him rise, the Temple GUARDS KICK at Him until Slowly, agonizingly, stands up again. JESUS is UNRECOGNIZABLE, yet has retained a mysterious majesty. A CUP of wine is brought to PILATE. He takes it, scans th crowd below, drinks. Then he stands up. Hush descends

You brought this man to me earlier, and I found no reason to condemn him. I deferred to king Herod and Herod found no cause in him. Therefore I will chastise him, then set him free. Baffled silence. Then the air EXPLODES with a roar. The nervous ROMAN SOLDIERS surrounding the Praetorium are JOINED BY OTHERS who have been kept outside. They lock th shields, WITHDRAW THEIR SWORDS and now form an IMPOSING F around the crowd of angry PHARISEES. The moment is tense, teetering on violent confrontation, PILATE looks down at the enraged mob below. He is clearly worried, and lifts his arms high over his head, Below, CAIPHAS coopts and is the first to shout:
Hush. He turns to PILATE, who acknowledges him curtly. (CONTINUED)

I have made it my custom, every year at the Pasch, to deliver a condemned criminal back to you. I am presently holding a well-known murderer in prison: Barabbas. Which of the two men would you have me release to you... Barabbas or Jesus, called the Christ?

(shout of indignation, rage) He is not the Christ. He is an impostor, a blasphemer. Free Barabhbas. Another voice in the crowd shouts out: “BARABBAS!” ~ this instantly becomes a general outcry, with the name BARABBA echoing like GUNSHOTS. More and more concerned by the turn of events, PILATE sig one of the ROMAN OFFICERS, who pushes forward a SCRUFFY, BEWILDERED MAN IN CHAINS (BARABBAS), who obviously doesn’ have any idea what is happening. At the sight of BARABBAS the crowd’s fury abates. PILATE stands up and moves dramatically half-way down the flight of stairs. He then points one arm toward BARABBAS standing above him and JESUS at the foot of the stairs.

Again I ask you...which of these two men should I deliver up to you? BARABBAS looks down at the figure at the foot of the stai JESUS lifts His eyes to BARABBAS. The crowd explodes again with roars of: “BARABBAS”
(shouts out) Barabbas. Deliver Barabbas up to us,
(shouts back) What would you have me do with Jesus of Nazareth?
Let him be crucified. DEAFENING ROAR of the crowd, echoing CAIPHAS’ words. (CONTINUED)

JESUS slowly turns and scans the multitude, all shouting his execution. At the BACK of the crowd MARY, JOHN and MAGDALEN try to p their way into the PRAETORIUM and closer to JESUS. The CHAOS and MOTION of the people is such that they are easily visible because of their CLEAR FORWARD MOTION. PILATE is obviously intimidated by the crowd’s mood, and about to retreat when he sees MARY, JOHN and MAGDALEN pus toward the foot of the stairs where JESUS stands, They suddenly step past the crowd, into the clearing, MARY rushes forward, almost reaches JESUS but is held bac a ROMAN SOLDIER just as her hands are about te touch JESU face. MAGDALEN has fallen to her knees and her face has broken into inaudible sobs at the sight of Him. JOHN has pale and become motionless. The shouts: CRUCIFY HIM, CRUCIFY HIM gain in power. MARY lifts her eyes to PILATE. The ROAR of the people bec deafening. He meets her gaze, then looks at JESUS

He bursts out of the PRAETORIUM, into the FORUM of PILATE palace. He comes to a dead stop as he crashes into JOHN, knocking him to the ground. (CONTINUED)

Dishevelled MAGDALEN cries out. MARY finds herself lookin DIRECTLY INTO THE BLOODSHOT EYES OF BARABBAS. The moment is brief. The GUARDS drag JESUS toward a marbled enclosure just OFF FORUM, at the center of which stands a GRANITE PILLAR: th FLAGELLATION ENCLOSURE. PILATE’S PALACE. DAY. MARY turns to JOHN.

Help me...stay near Him. We must not leave him, John. Ever leave him.. They approach the FLAGELLATION LOGGIA but are stopped nea the door. MARY turns to JOHN.

Oh, John...I cannot...watch this. Her face has become CHALK~LIKE and she COLLAPSES in a fai JOHN holds her in his arms and carries her away from the entrance to the Flagellation chamber. MAGDALEN follows him, reluctantly.

INSIDE, the TORTURERS have selected LONG, THIN, FLEXIBLE WHITE WOOD WHIPS to which are attached STRIPS OF LEATHER. They begin to RHYTHMICALLY WHIP the bare BACK of JESUS. EXT. FORUM. PILATE’S PALACE, DAY. The CROWD of people milling around the Forum is suddenly subdued, Many stop and watch the flagellation, but then m away from the entrance to the loggia. ONLY CAIPHAS, ANNAS and some of the ELDERS stay and watch each stroke from within the flagellation loggia. The TORTURERS now DROP their bloodied WHIPS and UNCHAIN JESUS. They TURN HIM AROUND, with His back to the PILLAR DRAG His arms up once more, and this time they tie down H legs as well. The NEW TORTURE INSTRUMENTS SELECTED are HORRENDOUS. They SMALL CHAINS or STRAPS covered with IRON HOOKS which, as LAND ON the CHEST, FACE and NECK, as well as the LEGS of JESUS, PENETRATE to the bone and TEAR OFF pieces of His flesh. The BLOOD now SPLATTERS the TORTURERS’ FACES as we as the PILLAR and the AREA surrounding it. cur TO: EXT. STREET OUTSIDE PILATE’S PALACE. MORNING. A small caravan of MEN RIDING CAMELS comes to a stop in f of the GATES. There are too many people milling about for them to pass. They peer inside the gates. From their position, they can see over people’s heads, PA THE PRAETORIUM, INTO THE FLAGELLATION ENCLOSURE. Their reaction to what they see is one of horror. The leader am them turns to a bystander:
Who is that man? What could he have done to deserve such punishment?
It is Jesus of Nazareth, whom both King Herod and Pilate have condemned.
That is not possible... (looks at his companions) I have heard him speak. He is a man of God...
{staring in horror at the flagellation scene) He...baptized me. And my children. They watch the torture with pained, baffled expressions.
After a last SLASH of leather and metal hooks on flesh, a SHORT MAN RUSHES to the pillar with a KNIFE IN HIS HAND. (CONTINUED)

Stop. Stop now. Do not scourge this man to death. He is innocent... The TORTURERS turns to CAIPHAS and ANNAS, bright-eyed wit sadistic eagerness and whe glare at JESUS. It is clear th would rather see Him finished off now. SHORT MAN (cont‘d) (also turns to Caiphas) Pilate will not be pleased to discover that his prisoner has been executed, Caiphas...you know that. Without waiting for a signal from CAIPHAS, the SHORT MAN the lines holding JESUS tied to the PILLAR. Even the ROMAN SOLDIERS lining the flagellation room are RELIEVED that the whipping has stopped, He then manages to UNTIE the CHAIN held by the RING at th top of the pillar. EXT. FORUM. PILATE’S PALACE. DAY. MARY's eyes open and she abruptly sits up. Her eyes meet JOHN’ s, then MAGDALEN’s, then she quickly STANDS, before have time to react, and steps to the entrance of the flagellation loggia. Here, she stops as CAIPHAS, ANNAS an the ELDERS, followed by a dozen others, including the TORTURERS, emerge and walk past her. INSIDE, MARY can HEAR SHOUTS BEFORE SHE CAN SEE ANYTHING.
Get up! On your feet!

Stand up, swine...or you'll have reason to blaspheme. MARY is joined by JOHN and MAGDALEN. They enter the loggi stop at the sight of JESUS lying motionless in the pool o blood, surrounded by the Temple GUARDS. Cover his nakedness. Just then CAIPHAS reappears at the entrance to the enclos With him is the BRUTISH GUARD who led the Guards in their first attempt to kill JESUS outside of HEROD’s Palace. He carries a torn and dirty SCARLET CLOAK which he roughly drapes over JESUS raw shoulders.

Allright, let’s go, Your Majesty. We don’t want to be late for our audience with the Roman Governor... They quickly march JESUS off, bent like an old man. CAIPH waits, and withdraws last, casting a look of scorn on JOH MARY and MAGDALEN. The FLAGELLATION LOGGIA is empty, all of a sudden. MARY, JOHN and MAGDALEN turn to the pool of JESUS’ blood.

EXT. PILATE’S PALACE. MORNING. The GUARDS are forced to move slowly, as JESUS is clearly exhausted and in serious pain. As they march, the BRUTISH GUARD in command is playfully weaving a sort of BRAID wit BRANCHES of THORNBUSH. When he is done he STOPS the group, walks up to JESUS and with mock solemnity JAMS the CROWN OF THORNS onto His hea The THORNS are all placed so that they DEEPLY GOUGE HIS SKULL, one of them driven CLEAN THROUGH AN EYELID. DARK BLOOD RUNS OUT OF THE FRESH WOUNDS. The BRUTISH GUARD then thrusts a large REED into JESUS’ hands, KNEELS BEFORE HIM and waves the procession forward
Hail, King of the Jews. General laughter, CAIPHAS studies JESUS with detached, scornful interest.

INT. PRAETORIUM. PILATE’S PALACE. MIDDAY. PILATE steps out onto the Platform once more, just as JES in His Scarlet CLOAK, WEARING THE CROWN OF THORNS and hol the REED in His hands, is brought in and is forced up the steps onto the platform. Below, the PRAETORIUM fills up once more. PILATE cannot take his eyes off JESUS ~ appalled by what been done to Him. As JESUS reaches the platform, PILATE m toward Him and, with gentleness, even FEAR, turns Him aro to face the rabble below, As the full extent of the damage done to JESUS becomes obvious, silence descends on the Praetorium. JESUS lifts His head, covered with the crown of thorns. H eyes briefly meet PILATE’s.
Ecce homo, Behold the man.

(loud) - If you release him, Excellency, you are not Caesar’s friend. He has made himself king, he is an enemy of Caesar ...it is your duty to crucify him. The CROWD ECHOES THE WORDS OF CAIPHAS, FILLING THE PRAETC WITH A GREAT DIN. Agitated now, PILATE points to JESUS,
(shouts) Are you not content? Look at him. If this man once thought he was king of the Jews, I am sure he no longer does.
He made himself the son of God. Crucify him. Another eruption of shouts “CRUCIFY HIM” from the crowd startles and intimidates PILATE. He turns to JESUS and, o the din below:
Speak to me. I have the power to crucify you, or else to set you free. (CONTINUED)
JESUS slowly, painfully lifts His battered face to PILATE His voice is remarkably strong.

You have no power over me, PILATE is mystified. JESUS (cont'd) But they who delivered me to you have the greater sin. PILATE turns to the infuriated crowd of Pharisees in the PRAETORIUM, then back to JESUS, He finally signals to one the ROMAN GUARDS to bring him a basin of water. This is placed between him and JESUS. JESUS leoks at the clear water:

JESUS stands at a long table, between JOHN and PETER. The rest of His Apostles sit on either side of JOHN and PETER Ali watch as He uncovers a CHALICE, places it on the tabl before Him, lifts a ROUND PLATE and place this OVER the shelf. He BLESSES the bread and oils which sit in small V next to the chalice and turns to PETER, PETER pours some into the chalice, which JESUS blesses by raising it up wi both hands. First JESUS turns to PETER who POURS WATER ON His hands, to JOHN, who follows suit. Their gestures are both imposi and mysterious.
INT. PILATE’S PALACE. DAY. PILATE dips his hands in the water as he faces the mob be the platform. They quiet down as he dramatically washes h hands before them and cries out:
TI have said I find no cause in him. You take him. You crucify him. I am innocent of the blood of this man. (CONTINUED)

May his blood be upon us, then, and upon our children. Pandemonium. CAIPHAS and ANNAS turn to the Temple GUARDS SHOUT IN THEIR EARS OVER THE TUMULT. THE BRUTISH GUARD points to PILATE. They look up. PILATE is INSCRIBING SOMETHING ON A FLAT WOODEN BOARD. Wh he is finished he hands the BOARD to a ROMAN GUARD who delivers it to CAIPHAS. CAIPHAS reads, then turns angrily to PILATE:
Place it on the cross for all to read.
KING OF THE JEWS? He is not King of the Jews, Governor! PILATE waits for some quiet, then, with contempt and authority:

What I have written I have written. PILATE exits, so eager to get away that he fails to see CLAUDIA near the exit, eyes fixed on the bent, nearly crushed, bleeding figure of JESUS. Galvanized by the HOWLING MOB, the TEMPLE GUARDS rush up stairs, take hold of JESUS and force Him down the stairs, stumbling and tripping. At the foot of the stairs He is met by the BRUTISH GUARD. The smile is sadistic, ominous.

EXT. PILATE’S PALACE GATES. DAY. MARY, JOHN and MAGDALEN are being shoved around by the excited mob emerging from the ROMAN GOVERNOR’s FORUM. The energy of the mob is hot, unfocused, primitive... filled animal anticipation. ROMAN SOLDIERS, in formation, try to keep the people away from a CLEARING just outside the OPEN GATES. The CROWD NO is LOUD, UNRELENTING. (CONTINUED)

BLARE of TRUMPETS. HORSEHOOVES on COBBLESTONE, PILATE eme from the GATES riding a STALLION. He is followed by A DOZ ROMAN CAVALRY OFFICERS. MAGDALEN is the FIRST to see the EXECUTIONERS emerge from gates directly behind the horsemen. They are a different, savage-looking lot of men. JESUS lowers His hands and puts the pieces of bread back the PLATE which he placed over the chalice. The BRILLIANC which envelops JESUS FLOWS from His fingers INTO THE BREA NOW BREAKS INTO BITE~SIZE MORCELS.

I am in the Father, and the Father is in me. I say this to you now; whoever receives me receives Him who sent me, JOHN’s eyes are focused with reverence on the plate. As JESUS finishes breaking the BREAD, He picks up the plate one hand, one of the bread morcels with the other. Turnin
JESUS (cont’d) Take this and eat. This is my body, which is given for you. As JOHN takes the bread and eats it, he is INFUSED with t same brilliance which surrounds the figure of JESUS.

JOHN is frozen into place, standing next to MARY. They bo seem incapable of drawing breath. SIMON’s eyes have filled with tears. MAGDALEN, on her hands and knees, now moves toward the cr to which JESUS is nailed, lying on the ground and surroun by the EXECUTIONERS. No one seems to notice her as she approaches, except ABENADAR, who does not stop her, but points her out to one of the FOOTSOLDIERS. ABANADAR himself is mesmerized by the grunting, sweaty, b soaked EXECUTIONERS. He is distracted by MOVEMENT. CAIPHA ANNAS and some cf the ELDERS approach the cross, They STAND OVER the stretched and agonizing figure of JES ignoring the groans of DISMAS and GESMAS nearby.
