For you. In exchange for...that (nods at the board) ABENADAR has spurred his mount and approached silently.

Sargent! You have your orders... The SARGENT nails the board onto the top of the cross, th runs back to the periphery of the execution ground. ABENADAR (cont’d) (looks at Annas and Caiphas) You...all of you, get back to where you were, behind the guards. No one is allowed here without dispensation. .go. Offended, and trying to look dignified, they retreat. On way, CAIPHAS nods secretly to the BRUTISH GUARD. The EXECUTIONERS have all noticed MAGDALEN as she has com a stop near the cross. She ignores them, the soldiers, ev ABENADAR on his tall mount. Her eyes are fixated on JESUS nailed and tied down to the cross. (CONTINUED)

Details of the crucifixion. They are jumpy, sometimes IN FOCUS, other times not: the CROWN of THORNS, the BLOOD dripping from His head onto the wood of the cross, the movement of his FINGERS beyond the hands immobilized by t nails, the trembling of His knees, BACK TO THE NAILS... t POINTS OF THE NAILS which have been HAMMERED IN, THROUGH OUT THE OPPOSITE SIDE of the wood. MAGDALEN has reverted to primordial sounds, but these abruptly STOP as she SCANS the wood UNDER the cross. She lifts her eyes to the agonizing figure of JESUS lying fla the wood. Her head shakes in silent disbelief. The BRUTISH Temple GUARD is focusing again on the cross. sees MAGDALEN peering UNDERNEATH the wood. He looks. His widens with sadistic anticipation. He locks at the EXECUTIONERS, who have started to put away their tools. H hits them, pushes them toward the cross:

LOOK, you monkeys! No...UNDER there! See anything? Do you see that? He CROUCHES, points, touches the point of one of the nail sticking out by six inches. BRUTISH GUARD (cont’d) Turn it on its face, imbeciles! Nail them DOWN FLAT, damn you all, or his majesty’1l drop off the minute we plant this tree! UP and OVER..! The men take hold of one whole side of the cross and HEAV upward until it TEETERS perilously on its SIDE. There is a minute of suspended motion, then the cross slo DROPS ON ITS FACE. As it FALLS, THREATENING TO CRUSH JESU UNDER ITS WEIGHT, TIME SLOWS DOWN. MAGDALEN covers her face with her hands. ABENADAR tries to control his mount, which has raised its on its hind legs and is backing away, snorting and shakin its head. MARY and JOHN rush forward, eyes wide with horror. The ROMAN FOOTSOLDIERS all turn to look as the CROWD gasp unison. (CONTINUED)

CAIPHAS, ANNAS and the members of the SANHEDRIM have gone still as they watch the cross COLLAPSE ONTO JESUS. Even DISMAS and GESMAS, suffering though they are on THEI crosses, watch with foreboding. The NOISE of the wood CRASHING onto ground is TREMENDOUS, A CLOUD OF DUST. Silence.

Darkness gradually enlarges to light. The silence is brok by the METALLIC SOUND OF HAMMERS ON IRON. Then the PICTURE of the UPSIDE-DOWN CROSS, the POINTS OF THE NAILS bending under rhythmic hammer-blows. MAGDALEN’s tear-filled eyes blink with each impact. She h not moved from where she was when the cross went over. No she lowers herself to the ground and LOOKS. MAGDALEN’s POV: The CROSS is SOLIDLY UPSIDE DOWN, yet NO PART OF JESUS touches the ground underneath it. MAGDALEN raises her head, looks at the faces of the EXECUTIONERS, then at the BRUTISH Temple GUARD, at ABENAD the soldiers...NO ONE HAS SEEN WHAT SHE HAS. MARY and JOHN, through a FOG. Now visible, now gone. They haven’t MOVED A MUSCLE. They haven’t seen it either. MAGDALEN lowers her head to the ground, and again looks. JESUS HOVERS above the ground, in a SPACE which WAS NOT T UNTIL HE OCCUPIED IT. MAGDALEN’s eyes close. The HAMMERING STOPS. A CACOPHONY of shouts and jeers erru from the crowd, punctuated by sadistic LAUGHTER.

Get the ropes ready. There. NO...not the arms, you blathering fools... the TRUNK! That’s it. MAGDALEN lifts her face, glares at the BRUTISH GUARD. BRUTISH GUARD (cont’d) Now straighten it. Quickly. We don’t want his majesty to die..-not yet... not here... (CONTINUED)

The sweaty, grumbling EXECUTIONERS take up the arm they u to TURN the cross over, and LIFT it up once again. The BRUTISH GUARD looks worried as he peers at JESUS, who body DANGLES awkwardly and in terrible agony. BRUTISH GUARD (cont’d)

text: The EXECUTIONERS now BACK AWAY from the crosses. MARY and JOHN, followed by SIMON and MAGDALEN, slowly APPROACH the cross of JESUS. ABENADAR watches them step forward with dignity. He climb off his horse, eyes glued to the bleeding figure of JESUS JOHN is first to reach the cross, and looks up.

The APOSTLES watch in silence as, still suffused with BRIGHTNESS, JESUS puts down the plate on which He had pla the MORCELS of BREAD. He picks up the CHALICE on which th plate had rested, and turns to PETER. PETER POURS wine into the CHALICE. It is a DEEP RED WINE as it FLOWS into the chalice, it is suffused with the RAD LIGHT coming from JESUS. When the chalice is full, He lif it over His head with both hands.

T will not drink again of the fruit of the vine until that day when I shall drink again with you in the kingdom of my Father. JESUS lowers the CHALICE, takes a small sip of wine and h the chalice to JOHN. JESUS (cont'd) Take and drink; this is my blood which is given for you. JOHN looks at the WINE inside the chalice, then again at RESPLENDENT face of JESUS. JESUS (cont’d) Do this in memory of me. cuT TO: EXT. GOLGOTHA. DAY. The BLOOD of JESUS is RUNNING along His torn limbs and do the length of the cross to the ground. JOHN’s eyes follow the flow and fill with fresh tears. MA stands next to him, her eyes lifted to the face of her So Her eyes are open and DRY. They meet His with a love and dignity only matched by His own. A NEARBY laugh, low and filled with malevolent scorn:

If you are the son of God, Jesus of Nazareth, why don’t you save yourself? Climb dewn off that cross...prove to us that you are who you say you are, JESUS slowly turns His eyes away from those of MARY. (CONTINUED)

GESMAS scans the gathered witnesses, particularly to CAIP ANNAS and the rest of the members of the Sanhedrim and, gritting his teeth, growls derisively: GESMAS (cont’d) Ha! I tell you, the demon this fool is possessed by is about to leave him. CAIPHAS approaches and looks up arrogantly at JESUS.

You said you could destroy the Temple and rebuild it in three days...and yet you cannot come down, off that cross. He turns and faces the crowd of witnesses: CAIPHAS (cont’d) If he is the Christ, the King of Israel, I say let him come down from the cross, that we may see and believe This is met by derisive laughter by many in the crowd. CAIPHAS laughs, starts to walk away. JESUS lifts His head upward and in a low voice:

Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do. CAIPHAS stops dead in his tracks, an astonished look on h face. He turns, looks at JESUS on the cross. DISMAS, who has watched the performance of GESMAS and CAI with distaste, now speaks out:

Listen to him. He is praying for you. He is truly a prophet I say to you, a king, the son of God. This causes the jeers to commence again, though less nois more hesitant. CAIPHAS spits at DISMAS, then withdraws ag to the margins of the execution ground. DISMAS then turns
DISMAS (cont’d) How can you speak the way you do? We deserve this, Gesmas, but he does not. He has done no evil! (CONTINUED)

DISMAS then bursts into tears of pain and guilt: DISMAS (cont'd) I have sinned, Jesus, and I am being justly punished. Condemn me, go ahead. You would be justified... JESUS turns to DISMAS who, in agony, is hyperventilating pain. He is dying, eyes turned to JESUS. DISMAS (cont’d) T ask only that you remember me, Lord, when you enter your kingdom.

Amen, I tell you, on this day you shall be with me in Paradise. DISMAS becomes RIGID. Air rattles out of his mouth. Slowl his features relax and he slumps down. GESMAS ROARS with demonic laughter. His malice is what se to keep him alive. JESUS turns to MARY and JOHN, MAGDALEN, SIMON and ABENADA who has joined them at the foot of the CROSS. MARY and JOHN reach out and TOUCH THE FEET OF JESUS. JESUS is breathing with difficulty. He tries to speak aga but His lips are so parched that a moment passes before t words can form: JESUS (cont’d) I thirst. Beat. JESUS (cont’d) Could you not have given me a little water? JOHN turns, mortified, to MARY. Then again at JESUS:
(whisper) We did not think, Lord... One of the ROMAN SOLDIERS nearby pours some liquid into a SPONGE and approaches the cross. ABENADAR stops him: (CONTINUED)

No, don’t mix vinegar with gall. Give him only vinegar. It will give him some relief... The SOLDIER squeezes out the liquid, refills the sponge w vinegar, places the sponge on a long reed and lifts it to mouth of JESUS, who drinks from it. MARY’s face looks as if it might suffer fracture.
(whisper) Oh Jesus, let me die with you... flesh of my flesh bone of my bone, heart of my heart... JESUS transfixes her with His eyes, then He looks at JOHN

Woman, behold, he is your son, From JOHN He turns again to MARY: JESUS (cont/’d) John, behold, she is your mother. MARY is overcome, She breaks into breathless sobs. JOHN helps her step away from the cross. ABENADAR takes the elbows of MAGDALEN and SIMON and guides them aw from the cross, following JOHN and MARY. An eerie SILENCE has fallen on the scene of crucifixion. GESMAS turns to JESUS and laughs.

See them? They are running away... abandoning you. You are alone. There is no one left. No one. JESUS lifts his eyes to the darkness enfolding GOLGOTHA. eyes fill with tears, which mingle with the blood pouring down His cheeks. Suddenly, in the HEAVY SILENCE, with a violent spasm of H tortured body, He shouts in a clear, powerful voice:
Eloi, Eloi, lamma sabacthani? (My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?) (CONTINUED)

MARY hears the cry of JESUS, She spins around to look at cross, which stands out against a dark silver sky, slips from JOHN’s sustaining hands and runs back. MARY is now the only one near the cross. Her suffering is much a part of JESUS’ own, and her KNOWLEDGE of the momen mysterious part of what is taking place that the REST of men and women on GOLGOTHA do not interfere. JESUS’ eyes are closed. His tears, mixed with the blood o His passion, roll off His cheeks to the ground. JESUS’ eyes open and He SEES MARY. There is a silent mome of transcendental understanding in each of their expressi of anticipation, pain and relief. Then: JESUS (cont'd) (softly) It is accomplished. The ONLY LIGHT NOW seems to emanate from JESUS’ face. MARY, alone, now witnesses JESUS as He slowly raises His to the silver~dark heavens and in a strong voice. JESUS (cont'd) Father, into Thy hands...I commend... my spirit. JESUS slowly lowers His head and exhales. A GREAT STILLNESS PEHRVADES THE DARKNESS which has descen on GOLGOTHA, and a GREAT SILENCE.
